title: Kruger National Park still a magnet for rhino poachers | Science & Environment
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK Related articles Hunting narrative tarnishes a vital industry Poacher-hunting dog serves on frontline of SA rhino battle in Kruger Game-hunters defend the right to shoot South Africa to host 2016 CITES talks SA undecided on sale of rhino horn stockpile SA Airlink to fly tourists directly to luxury safari lodges SA relocates 100 rhinos outside country to fight poaching In this article People: Edna Molewa RHINO poaching has risen in the Kruger National Park this year but is on the decline elsewhere in the country, Environment Minister Edna Molewa said on Sunday.
The park, the country’s main tourist draw, is on the frontlines of a surge in poaching for rhino horn to meet demand in countries such as Vietnam, where it is used in traditional medicine.
A record 1,215 rhino were poached in SA last year, almost triple the 448 killed in 2011.
Molewa said that as of August 27, 749 rhinos were known to have been illicitly killed in SA so far this year, 544 of them in Kruger. At this time last year, the nationwide total was 716, with 459 killed in Kruger.
Molewa said Kruger was still the epicentre of the crisis. "Kruger remains a magnet because of numbers. You won’t walk 2km in Kruger without coming across a rhino."
Kruger has the largest concentration of rhinos on the planet, with an estimated 8,000 to 9,000 white rhinos, about half of SA’s population of the species.
SA has more than 80% of the world’s rhino population with about 18,000 white rhinos and close to 2,000 black rhinos.
Fundisile Mketeni, CEO of South African National Parks, also pointed to Kruger’s size and topography as attractions for poachers. The park is the size of Israel and much of its terrain is remote, making it tough to police.
It also shares a 450km border with Mozambique, from where many poachers come.
So far this year, Molewa said, there has been a 27% increase in poachers entering the park. There were 12 active poacher groups at any given time on its 2-million hectares.
Arrests of suspected poachers in the park are also up to 138 so far this year, compared with 81 in the same period last year.
Reuters
